p: Clinically, the jaundice was the most commonly reported symptom (78%) and diarrhea was the least (27%) reported symptom. The average duration between the onsets of symptoms to the presentation at any health facility was 6.18 days, and it varied from 0 days to 49 days. Biochemical investigations of the patient have shown deranged liver functions in majority of the patients with mean total bilirubin levels of 6.67 ± 0.41 mg/dL ( n = 104), SGOT 1132.9 ± 72.56 U/I ( n = 133), SGPT 1291.6 ± 77.89 U/I ( n = 133).
